intro: Romulea schlechteriana, commonly known as the Cape goldcup, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant features grass-like leaves and produces showy, cup-shaped blooms that attract pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections worldwide.
